newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HKMA hopes for light IPO flow ahead of RTGS launch.
newsitem.headline: HKMA hopes for light IPO flow ahead of RTGS launch.

text.p: The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) on Thursday requested a delay in upcoming initial public offerings (IPO) to relieve tightness in the money market as it introduces a new money market settlement system.

Starting on Monday, the HKMA will implement a Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS) system in which banks can use Exchange Fund bills and notes to obtain interest-free intraday liquidity by carrying out intraday repurchase transactions with the HKMA.
"We expressed our wishes to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange that the IPO schedule will not be so tight during the first week of implementation of the RTGS," an HKMA spokesman said.
Analysts said heavy oversubscriptions of new listings has tightened liquidity in the money market.
In late November, the HKMA injected about HK$3.0 billion into the banking system to soothe tightness caused by month-end and equities-related demand.
With RTGS requiring banks to make real-time settlements instead of daily settlements, traders said a heavy schedule of IPOs could complicate the introduction of the new system.
Analysts said merchant banks have been given verbal requests from the HKMA to delay upcoming launches.
